intro: Rubus badius, commonly known as the blackberry bramble, is a species of flowering plant in the蔷薇科 (Rosaceae) family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves, which are typically trifoliate. The plant produces aggregate fruits, known as blackberries, which are edible and commonly consumed fresh or in jams. Rubus badius is native to North America and thrives in a variety of soil types, often in woodland or disturbed areas. It plays an important ecological role by providing food for wildlife and supporting pollinator populations.
